meanings.definition: The amount of information that fits on a computer or device screen at one time.
meanings.sent1: I could only read a screenful of the article before the page scrolled down.
meanings.sent2: The website displayed a screenful of images of cute puppies.
meanings.sent3: I tried to fit a screenful of popcorn in my mouth at once, but it was impossible!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a screenful of memories, each one vivid and colorful.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanation was so clear, it felt like a screenful of knowledge was right in front of me.

meanings.definition: The act of displaying or projecting something on a screen.
meanings.sent1: The screenful of the movie was so bright and clear, it felt like I was there.
meanings.sent2: During the presentation, the speaker showed a screenful of graphs and charts.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved making a screenful of rabbits appear out of nowhere!
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting was like a screenful of emotions, each stroke telling a story.
meanings.sent5: The concert was so amazing, it felt like a screenful of music was surrounding me.
